author: ElastiFlow
name: Brute Force Direct CLI Access - edge (fast)
description: An anomalously high number of failed connection attempts were observed to common remote CLI ports (SSH, telnet, etc.). This can indicate a brute force login attack.

author: ElastiFlow
name: CHARGEN Amplification Attack - edge
description: This DDoS attack is a reflection-based volumetric distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack in which an attacker leverages the functionality of open Character Generator Protocol (CHARGEN) services in order to overwhelm a target server or network with an amplified amount of traffic, rendering the server and its surrounding infrastructure inaccessible.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Generic DDoS Attack (UDP Amplification) - edge
description: This DDoS attack is a reflection-based volumetric distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack in which an attacker leverages the functionality of open UDP services in order to overwhelm a target server or network with an amplified amount of traffic, rendering the server and its surrounding infrastructure inaccessible.

author: ElastiFlow
name: DNS Amplification Attack - edge
description: This DDoS attack is a reflection-based volumetric distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack in which an attacker leverages the functionality of open DNS resolvers in order to overwhelm a target server or network with an amplified amount of traffic, rendering the server and its surrounding infrastructure inaccessible.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Port Scan Direct - edge (fast)
description: A client accessed an anomalously high number of server ports over a short period of time, compared to other clients. This can indicate port scanning activity, a reconnaissance method used by malicious actors to find vulnerable systems.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Port Scan Direct - edge (slow)
description: A client accessed an anomalously high number of server ports over a long period of time, compared to other clients. This can indicate port scanning activity, a reconnaissance method used by malicious actors to find vulnerable systems.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Generic DDoS Attack (TCP)
description: A Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) by directly sending a high-volume of TCP traffic to a target from multiple sources.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood Direct Attack - inbound
description: A ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood DDoS Attack - inbound
description: An ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic. When the attack traffic comes from multiple devices, the attack becomes a DDoS or distributed denial-of-service attack.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood Direct Attack - outbound
description: A ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood DDoS Attack - outbound
description: An ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic. When the attack traffic comes from multiple devices, the attack becomes a DDoS or distributed denial-of-service attack.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood Direct Attack - private
description: A ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Flood DDoS Attack - private
description: An ICMP flood is a denial-of-service attack in which the attacker attempts to overwhelm a targeted device with ICMP echo-request packets, causing the target to become inaccessible to normal traffic. When the attack traffic comes from multiple devices, the attack becomes a DDoS or distributed denial-of-service attack.

author: ElastiFlow
name: SYN Flood Direct Attack - inbound
description: A SYN flood (half-open attack) is a type of denial-of-service (DDoS) attack which aims to make a server unavailable to legitimate traffic by consuming all available server resources. By repeatedly sending initial connection request (SYN) packets, the attacker is able to overwhelm all available ports on a targeted server machine, causing the targeted device to respond to legitimate traffic sluggishly or not at all.

author: ElastiFlow
name: SYN Flood DDoS Attack - inbound
description: A SYN flood (half-open attack) is a type of denial-of-service (DDoS) attack which aims to make a server unavailable to legitimate traffic by consuming all available server resources. By repeatedly sending initial connection request (SYN) packets, the attacker is able to overwhelm all available ports on a targeted server machine, causing the targeted device to respond to legitimate traffic sluggishly or not at all.

description: A SYN flood (half-open attack) is a type of denial-of-service (DDoS) attack which aims to make a server unavailable to legitimate traffic by consuming all available server resources. By repeatedly sending initial connection request (SYN) packets, the attacker is able to overwhelm all available ports on a targeted server machine, causing the targeted device to respond to legitimate traffic sluggishly or not at all.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Scan Direct - edge (fast)
description: A source IP address sent ICMP packets to an anomalously high number of destination IP addresses over a short period of time, compared to other sources. This can indicate ICMP/ping scanning activity, a reconnaissance method used by malicious actors to discover networked systems.

author: ElastiFlow
name: ICMP Scan Direct - edge (slow)
description: A source IP address sent ICMP packets to an anomalously high number of destination IP addresses over a long period of time, compared to other sources. This can indicate ICMP/ping scanning activity, a reconnaissance method used by malicious actors to discover networked systems.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Rare Country - inbound
description: Inbound network traffic from a rare country has been observed. This can indicate a compromised system.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Rare Country - outbound
description: Outbound network traffic to a rare country has been observed. This can indicate a compromised system.

author: ElastiFlow
name: Rare Country - private
description: Private network traffic from a rare country has been observed. This can indicate a compromised system.
